intro: Diasperus leiostylus, commonly known as the slender-styled rock cress, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other mustard plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow in color. It has a low-growing habit with succulent leaves that help it conserve water in its harsh environment. Diasperus leiostylus is often found on rocky outcrops and in dry soils, where it thrives due to its adaptive features.
